meanings.def: the tube in the body through which food passes when it leaves the stomach
examples: It can take up to 72 hours for food to pass through the gut.
I had a terrible pain in my guts after eating too many plums.

meanings.def: the organs in and around the stomach, especially in an animal
examples: I'll only cook fish if the guts have been removed.
I don't like movies that are full of blood and guts (= that show a lot of blood and violence).

meanings.def: a person’s stomach, especially when it is large
examples: Have you seen the gut on him!
a beer gut (= caused by drinking a lot of beer regularly)

meanings.def: the courage and strength of mind that it takes to do something difficult or unpleasant
examples: He doesn't have the guts to walk away from a well-paid job.
It takes guts to keep on running even though you have blistered feet.
She had the guts to stand up to the school bully.

meanings.def: the place where your natural feelings that make you react in a particular way are thought to be
examples: in your guts I had a feeling in my guts that something was wrong.

meanings.def: the most important part of something
examples: the guts of the problem

meanings.def: thin strong string made from animals' intestines and used in making musical instruments, tennis rackets and medical equipment
to make a great effort to do something
examples: It’s a problem which nobody is going to bust a gut trying to solve.
I busted my chops to get into law school.
These guys were busting their butts on the field, trying to excel at athletics.

meanings.def: to make a decision based on something that you are certain about, even though you do not have any direct proof and cannot explain why you are certain
examples: I went with my gut and turned down the job.

meanings.def: used to refer to somebody who eats too much
examples: Make sure greedy guts doesn’t eat all the cake.

meanings.def: to be very angry with somebody and punish them severely for something they have done
examples: She’ll have your guts for garters if she ever finds out.

meanings.def: to work very hard to achieve something
examples: I slogged my guts out for the exam.

meanings.def: to tell somebody everything you know or feel about something, because you are upset
examples: He has spilled his guts in his new autobiography.

meanings.def: to destroy the inside or contents of a building or room
examples: be gutted (by something) The hotel was completely gutted by fire last year.
The house was completely gutted.

meanings.def: to remove the organs from inside a fish or an animal to prepare it for cooking
examples: The fish was already cleaned and gutted.

meanings.def: based on feelings and emotions rather than thought and reason
examples: a gut feeling/reaction
You have to work on gut instinct.
